Key Match Events: Mahmudullah pulls straight to deep square leg fielder
Rishad hits straight to cover
Rishad cuts late and ends the over with a boundary
Rishad pulls the short ball over mid wicket for SIX!
Shanto goes for a pull but ends up getting a top edge straight to deep third
Shanto uses reverse sweep but only for a single
Shanto tries to pull the fourth from his pads but miscues, dot ball
Tanzid tries to cut but is done by the wrong one, given LBW
Litton goes for the repeat of the last shot, but this one is much wider and slower, ends up holing out to deep square leg
Hardik swings for the hills on the leg-side but gets an outside edge that goes to the deep third boundary
Hardik pulls this over deep midwicket for one more
Hardik waits for this one and pulls this for a flat six over deep midwicket
Dube steps out to meet the ball and deposits it over midwicket for a maximum
Dube thumped this straight down the ground for a single
Pant steps out and hammers this over midwicket for a maximum
Pant hooks this straight to short third man and his brief but bright knock comes to an end
Pant drives through cover and mid-off for a boundary
Pant swings across the line and clears the midwicket boundary
Pant slaps the ball towards midwicket and deposits it over the rope
Pant swings across the line and clears the midwicket boundary
Pant slaps the ball towards midwicket and deposits it over the rope
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh wins the toss and opts to bowl first.
India wanted to bat and that’s what they got.
Bangladesh’s plan is to restrict India to a small total.
Bangladesh knows the conditions here and also about the wind factor.
150-160 will be a good score for Bangladesh.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India ends the first six overs at 53 for one, bettering its previous best of 50 runs against Pakistan during the group stage.
This was the 100th meeting between the two teams.
